sentence: This is an event I will never forget.  I am considered a good á mimic.  This particular day we were waiting for a professor á to take her class.  This  professor had a peculiar accent and a á very horrible way of lecturing and to top it all we had this á class at the fag end of the day.  So this particular day I got á into my element and started imitating the professor, and the á professor entered the class right in the middle of it .  I was á unaware of her presence, some of my friends tried to warn me but á it was of no avail as I was too engrossed in mimicing.  Then I á suddenly noticed the silence and turned around to see her á entering the class.  I do not know till today if she actually saw á what I had been doing or she had completely ignored it.  Through  á out that lecture I died of shame.  All the more shameful was the á fact that she gave me a character certificate.

sentence: I was for the first time on a brigade this year. At that time my á sister was to bear a child. I was mad with joy when I opened the á telegram from my parents and learned I had a nephew.

sentence: I was watching television. It was about midnight when a very dear á friend called saying that his father had died in an accident.

sentence: A) A documentary in which baby fur seals were being á clubbed/spiked to death by Canadian seal-hunters. Brutally á graphic. B) Description of a disfigured orphaned child in Hiroshima á calling for her mother.

sentence: I spend the night with my boyfriend, while there was also a á friend of his. We all lay on the floor to sleep. When my á boyfriend was fallen asleep the other boy and I started petting. á After 15 minutes I felt miserable and awoke my boyfriend to tell á him that.

label: sadness
sentence: My mother suffers from a mental illness.  One night she was not á feeling well and was sent to the hospital.  I was scared that á she would die, and all night I was very sad and did not dare to á close my eyes.

sentence: One of my good friends had to migrate to America.  Our friendship á had developed quite well and it was a pity as our friendship would á fade.

sentence: Last night I had a chat with a fellow student.  I had known her á for about half a year, and for the first time we were speaking á \the same language\"- meaning an inspiring discussion and á encounter."

As it was a festival day they á had to offer a hen to the Goddess so they cut the head off a hen á right in front of my eyes.  I felt disgusted and evenb gave up á eating meat after this incident.

sentence: One day I got on the bus without any money or season ticket and á the driver threw me out.

sentence: One fears many things, for example one fears going to the á dentist. but as far as I am concerned this feeling is connected á with the examination session.

sentence: One day I felt dizzy during a lecture.  When the lecturer asked á us as to who had heard the fairy tale - I was the only one who á put up his hand and this surprised the whole class.

sentence: When I was a young teenager (14)  my brother-in-law to be had á made heavy advances to me.  I did not understand very well what á it was all about but I reacted strongly and the feelings are á still there.

sentence: I was playing with friends then I decided to splash some sand á into a car which was moving nearby. The driver got angry and came á to report to my parents.

sentence: I slapped my sister's daughter and after several hours, she had a á high temperature and she ended up being admitted in hospital.

sentence: When my grandmother, who has been living with us for 14 years, á had a stroke and was left paralysed on one side. She has been á quite close to our family and to see her suffer in this way makes á me feel really sad.

label: disgust
sentence: I saw the gare of a prison.  This gare and the building were in á deplorable condition and were full of rubbish.

sentence: I ate a Runeberg's cake, though I knew that I would immediately á put on a kilo.

sentence: Encouter with a prostitute.

sentence: I felt shame when I found that I was almost last in the exam.

sentence: When my mother got a terrible beating from my father.  It was so á bad that she fainted and it was only then that my dad realized á how bad it was.

label: guilt
sentence: When I cancelled an appointment with an idle story. Afterwards á it appeared that the person had looked forward to it and reserved á time for it.

sentence: When I was concentrating on my work, my friend disturbed me á continously.  I asked him to stop but in vain.

sentence: A nuisance used to live in our flat a month ago. I experienced á this feeling when I tried to chase her out.

sentence: I quarrelled with my brothers (twins) at home on saturday.  One á of them studies in a private school and the other one is á repeating his form five.  They do not know what they are doing.  á They follow every word of their teachers, books and systems.  á They always try to rationalize their bad acts by some game and á they are satisfied with their awkward life.  I have tried to á persuade them very often but have failed.  This time I had a á fight as they have no voluntary spirit (they did not polish the á floor).

label: guilt
sentence: I lied to one of my best friends.

sentence: I was unaware that I had walked the streets in torn trousers.

sentence: For instance when a girl is interested in me and likes me.

sentence: After a party I spent the night with a friend. We both were á drunk, the morning was disillusioning. A friend was me leaving á the room and I felt shabby and immoral.

sentence: At a meeting with over one hundred people, they decided who had to speak á from the stand by drawing lots.

sentence: When I saw parents punishing their little child for something he á had not done.  In my opinion, even if he had done it he should á not have been punished for it.

sentence: After an exhausting day I came home and wanted to take a bath to á relax. My father wanted to take a bath first and when he had á finished after an hour, there was no hot water left for me.

sentence: On May 20th I got a summon to appear in court on May 28th 1985 on á the subject of impregnanting a school girl. I really feared of á standing in the court in a few days time after this notice. I was á also embarassed due to formal approach that was expected of me to á the Principal.

label: shame
sentence: I was saying bad things about a man I had never seen.  I was á with a friend and did not know that she was related to this man.  á My friend did not tell me about it and I discovered this myself.

label: sadness
sentence: The funeral of a friend who was killed in a car accident. She was á of my own age, there were many of my own friends present, as well á as her family etc.

label: guilt
sentence: After confronting the person who stood me up, I blew up and said á all the wrong things.

label: guilt
sentence: When I cheated my father and told him that the school á administration wanted K80 for the purchase of a mini-bus.  Two á months later the school authorities wrote back to my father for á the money.  I could not go back and ask him for the money again á as he had already given it to me once.

label: joy
sentence: When I was admitted to the Bulgarian State Conservatoire.

label: fear
sentence: When I entered the dissecting room for the anatomy class and saw á several dead bodies lying on the benches.

label: shame
sentence: I was in a bus with my school material when I fell and sat on the á lap of another passenger.

label: joy
sentence: When I won a tennis match.

label: shame
sentence: A serious drug error while nursing that I knew I was responsible á for (patient lived, no complications fortunately).

label: sadness
sentence: Once my friend and I got into into a hot discussion on a very á controversial topic.  At one point of the argument I disagreed á with her totally and I took what she was saying as an insult.  So á I couter-argued and unknowingly hurt her emotionally, I felt very á sad about this.

label: guilt
sentence: During my holidays I had a boyfriend who turned away from me á outwardly. Therefore I danced with another man and raised certain á hopes in him. After a while I had to explain to him the á circumstances

label: disgust
sentence: When I first saw the state of a cafeteria in the grounds of the á university. Due to students own lack of concern for the á environment in which they eat and drink. Rubbish and spilled tea á and coffee left everywhere.

label: disgust
sentence: When mum had beaten my young sister just because she had received á a letter from a boyfriend.

label: shame
sentence: When I failed the ninth standard exam in school.

label: joy
sentence: A friend of mine that is abroad undertook recently an axam to á enter on University in Dallas, and was approved.

label: disgust
sentence: A series about Freud was shown on TV.  In it, a tampon had been á set in the nose of a woman, and forgotten there.  After great á pain it was taken off (close-up picture), the woman was bleeding á from the nose and the mouth.

label: fear
sentence: Staying alone in the dark.

label: disgust
sentence: A rich man expressing disgust towards an alcoholic.

label: shame
sentence: Not being able to argue against class leaders.

label: joy
sentence: When I received a letter from a woman I thought had not ever á cared for me.  This was when I needed her and I was overjoyed to á learn that it was me who was delaying things.

label: anger
sentence: Falling in love although she is my friend (angry with myself).

label: anger
sentence: When being made look a fool by the teacher in front of the class á during a turn.

label: disgust
sentence: When I was a child I broke plates because I wasn't given food on á the grounds of coming home late.

label: joy
sentence: Joy for me is when all my family gather around home for special á occasions as Christmas etc. It really gives me joy to see my á family and relatives and to observe natures productivity process á which have been going on for centuries.

label: disgust
sentence: When a begggar approached me for money, I felt disgusted.

label: shame
sentence: When a certain drunk man slapped my buttocks when I was quietly á standing waiting for a bus.

label: sadness
sentence: The time I lost a badminton match, that I should have won at the á Zambia closed badminton championships.

label: fear
sentence: Whenever I think of enrolling in Organic Chemistry.

label: anger
sentence: When my mother told things to my sister, which I told my mother á in confindence.

label: guilt
sentence: When I decided to move away from my parent's home, my mother told á me that it was as if a part of her had been torn out of her.

label: fear
sentence: When I got lost in New York city a late friday night with a á friend of mine.

label: joy
sentence: The day I was happiest was the day when I received a phone call á from Eve's Weekly to inform me that I had won the first prize of á the All India Essay competition.  I had won this prize when I was á an under-graduate when even post graduates had participated.  I á had been judged by eminent judges and political scientists.

label: guilt
sentence: Squeezed the puppy in the door.

label: anger
sentence: I get angry with my brothers and sisters when they do something á that I do not like.  They know this and still do it so as to á tease me.

label: anger
sentence: At work, when an elderly man complained unjustifiably about me and á distrusted me.

label: fear
sentence: I was visiting my parents in law when the house was invaded by á three strange men, and they committed an armed assault.

label: fear
sentence: I got lost in a foreign town. I did not know the language of that á country and it took me hours to meet my friends again.

label: shame
sentence: Insulted my girlfriend during a peptalk.

label: joy
sentence: Hear my name on the list attending the English lectures.

label: anger
sentence: I was subject to false accusations, and got very angry.

label: sadness
sentence: So as to be closer to the university I have left home and moved á into Auckland. It now seems as if I have left home - especially á my family - forever.

label: guilt
sentence: At a party, I started talking to a guy I had seen in one of my á classes. My boyfriend felt awkward and left to talk to a friend á but kept on looking at me as I talked.

label: joy
sentence: I was studying in the library and a class-mate told me that she á had obtained a grant to work in the library.

label: shame
sentence: When I was 15 my mother discovered various items in my room which á 15 year olds aren't usually expected to have - mainly alcohol, á marijuana and contraceptives !

label: shame
sentence: Every time I do not write something well in English.

label: disgust
sentence: When I made love with someone who I didn't really love. Sometimes á I even considered him unlikable.

label: shame
sentence: My boyfriend's mother, whom I had not met earlier, made an á unexpected visit.  I was lying lazily on the bed, reading a á newspaper and my boyfriend was studying.

label: anger
sentence: In a very important basket-ball match where a lot was at stake, I á played very badly.

label: disgust
sentence: I had experienced odd moments one time when a patient came into á the Ward in which I was working. The patient was badly burnt in á the right side of her body. I was very nervous at the sight.

label: shame
sentence: Equivocal situation when filling a security questionnaire on á entering a government building with several people there.

label: sadness
sentence: The passing away of my mum.

label: joy
sentence: [ I feel a sense of joy whenever I complete a piece of writing á which is part of my work.  Intense reading also brings me joy.  I á also feel happy when I reminiscent about them.]

label: guilt
sentence: I lied to my mother in the sixth form she said she would ring to á find out and I had to tell her I had lied.

label: fear
sentence: When I saw a ghost.

label: guilt
sentence: Some boys told me your nickname is \Little Girl Doctor\", I did á not tell them off and laughed with them."

label: fear
sentence: When I was coming back home alone at night.

label: shame
sentence: I am ashamed when I am not prepared in a subject and I have to á answer in the presence of the patients.

label: joy
sentence: When I was offered a high position of trust, which I later á accepted.

label: sadness
sentence: When I went to see the result of an exam and saw that I had á failed.

label: sadness
sentence: When I had stayed abroad for a long time and I had remembered á about my friends and relatives. I felt sad and I wanted to see á them as soon as possible.

label: sadness
sentence: My younger brother and sister were involved in an accident on á their way back from school and my brother was quite badly hurt.

label: shame
sentence: When I promised to help a friend over a weekend and did not keep á the promise.

label: shame
sentence: My sister said I am not a stable person, and I think she is á right.

label: sadness
sentence: Losing a pet chick. Our family had just put the chick outside a á few days before and then one morning it was gone.

label: fear
sentence: We were riding in a friend's car.  He was driving very fast and á suddenly a another car crossed the road in front of us.  My á friend had to turn the car rapidly.

label: sadness
sentence: When I heard that my Uncle had passed away in a road traffic á accident.

label: disgust
sentence: Class leader told me to collect homework for him.

label: joy
sentence: My boy-friend told me that he would take me to the training of á the life-saving dogs.

label: joy
sentence: I had a very close friend who went to Canada after her F.B, his  á departure was unavoidable.  When he came back during the Summer á holidays I was very happy as nothing had changed between us.

label: fear
sentence: I was spending my summer holidays in a village.  My friend and I á were coming back from a discotheque at night and we heard a noise á from an alley.  We were very scared and we got into my friend's house. á  A moment later, an unknown car picked up a person from this á alley.

label: disgust
sentence: When I heard that a woman of my community had aborted and got rid á of the foetus by throwing it in the drain.

label: sadness
sentence: A good friend of mine died. During the funeral I felt an intense á feeling of sadness.

label: disgust
sentence: The murder of two girls on a school trip to Berlin (and sexual á crimes generally) a couple of years ago.

label: guilt
sentence: Wrongly accused a classmate.

label: fear
sentence: When I was in the army, a room mate of mine came back from á furlough and threatened another fellow with a knife.

label: shame
sentence: I didn't tell my parents that I was going to Sofia. I told them á that I was going to a seminar. My mother knew that I was lying but á she didn't stop me.

label: sadness
sentence: When I heard that my father had passed away.

label: sadness
sentence: A dear friend was removed from the division whre I work.

label: disgust
sentence: A person I know who tells lies and so pretending to be better á than she is.

label: guilt
sentence: When I had had the possibility to act or to do certain activity á better but I had not done it because of reluctance or á carelessness.
